revised_title: Theoretical Considerations of the Effects of Solvent Medium on Molecular Energy Levels
tldr: This article discusses the impact of the environment on molecular energy levels, focusing on the effects of the solvent medium. The authors argue that the solvent's dielectric constant and its influence on the central solute molecule's fluctuating electrostatic field play a crucial role in determining the energy levels. They also explore the implications of these findings for electronic and vibrational spectra, as well as nuclear resonance.
